item.title: Road drain blocked with decomposed leaves, 7th February
item.description:
The drain outside 235 Brooklyn Road Cheltenham is blocked and causing flooding on the road.

item.title: Hazard to road users, particularly those on two wheels, 7th February
item.description:
Along the length of New Barn Lane between the Bouncers Lane roundabout and the park and ride roundabout there are numerous hazardous potholes. Many of these are hazardous to two wheel rod users. Cyclists, motorcyclists and e-scooter users who, despite their best efforts to avoid the hazards, hit them are likely to be thrown from their vehicles resulting in serious injury or death.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 209, New Barn Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 6th February
item.description:
There are numerous potholes in the carriageway causing an uncomfortable experience when travelling Westbound away from the Hot Air Balloon roundabout towards Gloucester. The potholes are without 80m after leaving the roundabout heading towards Gloucester/M5. The potholes start on the offside of the road mainly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Persistent flooding on Old Gloucester Road (B4634) creating serious danger to road users and pedestrians, 6th February
item.description:
Old Gloucester Road (B4634), at what3words location ///deny.secret.posed There is persistent and worsening flooding at this location which creates a serious hazard for pedestrians, cyclists and motorists. This is a 50 mph road with blind bends. During and after rainfall, standing water covers a long stretch of carriageway and completely submerges the narrow footpath in places, forcing pedestrians into the live traffic lane. This route is used to reach nearby bus stops and the main cycle route. Drivers frequently move into the centre of the road to avoid the deepest water, which is extremely dangerous given the restricted visibility. Cyclists are particularly at risk. Debris and damaged car parts have been left at the roadside, indicating vehicles are striking submerged defects or suffering water-related damage. Floodwater appears to be emerging from one roadside drain rather than flowing into it. A nearby brook is not full when this occurs, suggesting that the drainage system between the road and the brook may be blocked, collapsed or inadequate. The worst areas remain flooded long after rainfall has stopped. This has been a longstanding issue for several years and appears to be getting worse each winter rather than improving. Please urgently investigate and resolve the drainage failure at this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water ponding on carriageway, 6th February
item.description:
Water ponding on Bridge Street. Ponding along marked disabled bay and across dropped kerb. No highway drainage present. Problem persistent in wet conditions

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bridge Street, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
